column4: MAP_127246_CIBCMellon_CDS_PTM_Processing

This function is required to maintain, move and inquire on the CIBC Mellon GSS Ledger to support trade settlement or to ensure deposit and withdrawal transactions have been appropriately posted at CDSX.

This function is required to maintain, move and inquire on the CIBC Mellon GSS Ledger to support trade settlement or to ensure deposit and withdrawal transactions have been appropriately posted at CDSX.

This function is required to maintain, move and inquire on the CIBC Mellon GSS Ledger to support trade settlement or to ensure deposit and withdrawal transactions have been appropriately posted at CDSX.
This function allows the user to view any subscribed alerts sent by the CDSX system through the CDSX GUI or by email sent from CDSX.

The Corporate Action (CA) Dashboard provides updates in the events created through a Graphical Representation. The CA Dashboards provides event details at multiple levels using Pie charts. This is one of the functions used by the user to inquire on CA Events posted within the CDS Entitlements Menu which may affect trade settlement.

This is one of the functions used by the user to inquire on CA Events posted within the CDS Entitlements Menu which may affect trade settlement. Users can perform a Blank search or provide Event Type, Payment Status, Event ID, Base Security ID, Due Bill Indicator, Record Date From, Record Date To, Option Payment Date From, Option Payment Date To, Due Bill Redemption From and Due Bill Redemption To.
Glossary description not available. Value is considered to be self-explanatory.
This funds is to set up CDS funds deposits
Access to inquire on International Deliveries (trades via the international hub).
Access to perform International Deliveries (trades via the international hub).

This function is required to process deposits and withdrawals within CDSX. Account movement is used to transfer the balance between two accounts of the same ledger or between accounts of different ledgers under the same company.
This function allows user to query on deposits within CDSX.
This function allows user to query on withdrawals within CDSX.

This function allows user to inquire on Securities set up in CDSX. At Event Anticipation Calendar is a calendar system that captures and maintains predetermined features of a security, such as dividend, interest, maturity, DRIP, retraction privileges and partial call in CDSX. It is a part of a financial instrument that includes maintains and standards Corporate Actions menu.

Function is to inquire on Events posted within the CDS Corporate Actions menu as a Depository Participant (DP). This function is required to inquire on Events posted within the CDS Corporate Actions menu.

Function allows user to query the details of a security within the Financial Instruments menu in the CDSX GUI. The financial instrument captures and maintains various details of instruments in CDSX. The user can search for the various security parameters security in CDSX using the search criteria.

This function is to perform inquiries and view Non-Exchange trades within the 'Trade Confirmation Statistics' menu under the 'Trade Services' parent menu. Non-Exchange Trades are off-market trades that are not settled through the exchange. The participants directly report these trades in CDSX. Non-Exchange Trade in CDSX is a four-eye process, which means that its creation must be confirmed by the acceptor of the trade. CDSX provides a detailed view of these trades through the trade confirmation...

Non-Exchange Trades are off-market trades that are not settled through the exchange. The participants directly report these trades in CDSX. Non-Exchange Trade in CDSX is a four-eye process, which means that its creation must be confirmed by the acceptor of the trade. CDSX provides a detailed view of these trades through the trade confirmation...

This function is to perform inquiries and view Non-Exchange trades within the 'Trade Confirmation Statistics' menu under the 'Trade Services' parent menu. Non-Exchange Trades are off-market trades that are not settled through the exchange. The participants directly report these trades in CDSX. Non-Exchange Trade in CDSX is a four-eye process, which means that its creation must be confirmed by the acceptor of the trade. CDSX provides a detailed view of these trades through the trade confirmation...
TBD
This function is required to order to facilitate payment to brokers.

This function is required to process deposits and withdrawals within CDSX. Participants create deposit requests to convert the physical certificates, or deposit statements into an equivalent number of securities in their ledgers. Before performing a deposit, the users must review the security setup under the financial instrument's module.

This function is required to process deposits and withdrawals within CDSX. Withdrawal is the process of withdrawing securities from a ledger into a physical certificate or Direct Registration Statement (DRS). The RTA (Registrar/Transfer Agent) must confirm withdrawal requests initiated in CDSX, foreign depository or global security as specified in the request and attached with the security. Before performing a withdrawal, the users must...
A transfer request function is used to create the buyback (BB) by a Depository Participant (DP) and the Treasury Order transaction by a registrar/transfer agent type (RTA).
A transfer request function is used to create the market purchase (MP) transactions by a Depository Participant (DP) and the Treasury Order transaction by a registrar/transfer agent type (RTA).

This function allows user access to view company profile set up. Profiles are used to set up customers (i.e., participants, service bureaus, etc.), to control access to online functions and to identify the types of business functions they can perform. CDS customers must review their profiles to ensure that they are correct. If there are any discrepancies, they should notify CDS Customer Service.

This function is required to inquire on CIBC Mellon's CAP (Company Allocated Principal) set by CIBC. Assigned at the CMT company code level.
This function is required to inquire on CIBC Mellon's ACV (Aggregated Collateral Value) allocation and Sector Limits, assigned at the CMT company level.
